try this quickly, in term type sudo modprobe snd-   but dont press enter press TAB till you see the module for your card

we trying to find out the name of the module for your sound card, then we add whatever that name is to the end of the command "sudo modprobe snd-" the goal is to put in sudo modprob snd-al260 or whatever the card is
type in sudo modprobe snd- then press TAb, read through the file , you'll recognise it when you see it

check in alsamixer if external amp is on, press m on it

green means something is on, grey means off, so use arow keys till you se amp, press m when its highlighted

ok put this in term sudo apt-get --purge remove linux-sound-base alsa-base alsa-utils
